sense.name: a geometric form containing an arc and two radii
sense.commentary: SECTOR[+entity][+form][+portion][+mathematical][+angled] 15dec06 - modified features of Sense 2, added example. ahouston
sense.examples: She had the children divide the circle into four different-colored sectors. The angle of this sector is 30 degrees.

sense.name: a group within society, a sphere of activity
sense.examples: The mayor has chosen several members of the business sector for his task force. The bilingual sector of society has been growing over the decades. The contestants come from all sectors of society. This mutual fund invests in the transportation and energy sectors.

sense.name: a specific social state, or situation
sense.examples: John feels certain sectors of his personal life are out of control. In some sector of her mind there was still a trace of doubt.

sense.name: portion of a track of storage on a computer disk
sense.examples: This program will identify the bad sectors on your disk drive. Compressing your files consolidates information otherwise fragmented across separate sectors of storage.

sense.name: defined regions, locales, under military control
sense.examples: There have been reports of rioting in the fourth sector of the city. The victorious army divided the conquered city into ten sectors.

sense.name: an instrument with two metal arms for drawing geometric forms
sense.examples: The boy punched a hole in his paper by pushing too hard on his sector. Make two intersecting circles with your sector.
